title: Two Fed Officials Signal Support for Starting Bond Buying Taper
sub_head: Philadelphia Fed’s Harker says he doesn’t expect interest rate increases until late next year or early 2023
body:
Two Federal Reserve regional bank presidents said Wednesday they are on board with the U.S. central bank soon pulling back on its bond buying stimulus efforts.
Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia President Patrick Harker said he supports slowing the pace of central bank asset buying soon but sees no urgency to raise the central bank’s short-term rate target.
